summary:
The Security Council, 
Recalling its previous resolutions and statements on C么te d'Ivoire, reaffirms its commitment to the country's sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity, and unity. 
The Council supports the impartial forces, including the United Nations Operation in C么te d'Ivoire (UNOCI) and the French forces, and endorses the 4 March 2007 Ouagadougou political Agreement. 
It decides to extend the mandate of UNOCI and the French forces until 16 July 2007 and remains actively seized of the matter, determining the situation in C么te d'Ivoire continues to threaten international peace and security in the region.
